Package org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.filter

Class ExplainedFilter<T>

java.lang.Object
org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.filter.ExplainedFilter<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Domain of the predicate (i.e., type of the values to filter).
All Implemented Interfaces:
Predicate<T>
public class ExplainedFilter<T> extends Object implements Predicate<T>
An ExplainedFilter records for which reasons elements were filtered. More generally, ExplainedFilter is a predicate that composes other predicates with and semantics. ExplainedFilter keeps track how often each sub-predicate evaluated to false. ExplainedFilter is intended to be used as a filter in streams.
Author:
Paul Bittner

    • ExplainedFilter

      public ExplainedFilter​(Stream<TaggedPredicate<String,​T>> namedFilters)
      Creates an ExplainedFilter by conjunction of all given filters.
      Parameters:
      namedFilters - Filters to compose. Each filter has to be explained by a (unique) name.

    • ExplainedFilter

      @SafeVarargs public ExplainedFilter​(TaggedPredicate<String,​T>... filters)
      Same as ExplainedFilter(Stream) but with variadic arguments.

  • Method Details

    • Any

      public static <A> ExplainedFilter<A> Any()
      Creates an explained filter that always returns true. It will never count any filter hits and thus has no explanations.

    • test
